items.title: Configure a Node to Validate a Subnet with Lux-CLI
items.description: This page demonstrates how to configure nodes to validate an Lux Subnet. Validation via Lux-CLI is currently only supported on Testnet.

items.title: Configure Nodes to Validate the Primary Network with Lux-CLI
items.description: This page demonstrates how to configure nodes to validate the Lux Primary Network. Validation via Lux-CLI is currently only supported on Testnet.

items.title: Deploy a Custom VM Using Lux-CLI
items.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy a blockchain run with a custom virtual machine using cloud-based validators using the Lux-CLI.

items.title: Execute a SSH command on a Cluster
items.description: This page demonstrates how to execute a SSH command on all nodes of a Cluster using the Lux-CLI.

items.title: How to Import a Subnet into Lux-CLI
items.description: This guide demonstrates the process of importing a Subnet to the Lux-CLI to enable better management of the Subnet's configuration. This how-to uses the WAGMI Subnet deployed on Testnet as the example Subnet.

items.title: How to Run Lux-CLI with Docker
items.description: This guide demonstrates how to run Lux-CLI in a docker container.

items.title: How to Use Lux-CLI to Transfer P-Chain Funds
items.description: If you need to send funds to your Subnet control key or need to move funds from one Ledger address index to another, this guide will demostrate how to enable direct transfers between ledger P-Chain addresses using the Lux-CLI command `lux key transfer`.

items.title: Install Lux-CLI
items.description: This guide demonstrates how to install Lux-CLI.

items.title: Install Lux-CLI
items.description: This guide demonstrates how to install Lux-CLI.

items.title: Lux-CLI
items.description: Lux-CLI is a command-line tool that gives developers access to everything Lux. This release specializes in helping developers build and test Subnets.

items.title: Lux-CLI
items.description: Lux-CLI is a command-line tool that gives developers access to everything Lux. This release specializes in helping developers build and test Subnets.

items.title: Run an Lux Validator on AWS with One Lux-CLI Command
items.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy Lux validators using just one Lux-CLI command.

items.title: Run an Lux Validator on GCP with One Lux-CLI Command
items.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy Lux validators using just one Lux-CLI command.

items.title: Setup a Devnet Using Lux-CLI
items.description: This page demonstrates how to setup a Devnet of cloud-based validators using the Lux-CLI.

items.title: Stop Nodes Originally Created with Lux-CLI
items.description: This page provides instructions for halting cloud server nodes established by Lux-CLI.
